title: This Lecture â€“ Agenda

definitions.Chain-of-Thought (CoT): A method of reasoning that involves a sequence of thoughts leading to a conclusion.
definitions.Zero-shot reasoner: A type of reasoner that can make inferences without prior examples.
definitions.Few-shot reasoner: A type of reasoner that requires a few examples to make inferences.
definitions.Analogical Reasoning: A type of reasoning that involves drawing parallels between similar situations.
definitions.Multimodal Reasoning: A type of reasoning that involves multiple modes of input or output.
definitions.Multimodal CoT: A type of Chain-of-Thought that involves multiple modes of input or output.
definitions.Commonsense Knowledge: Knowledge that is widely accepted and used by most people.

formulas: No formulas present in the slide.
summary: The lecture agenda covers the basics of reasoning, including Chain-of-Thought (CoT) with zero-shot and few-shot reasoners, Analogical Reasoning, Multimodal Reasoning, and Commonsense Knowledge. It also discusses Reasoning Benchmarks.
